abstract.text: A structure that converts between decimal values and their textual representations.

, for working with percentages and currencies, respectively. Each format style includes a configuration that determines how it represents numeric values, for things like grouping, displaying signs, and variant presentations like scientific notation.

. You can customize numeric formatting for a style by adjusting its backing configuration. The system automatically caches unique configurations of a format style to enhance performance.
Foundation provides other format style types for working with the numeric types that the Swift standard library defines.

inlineContent.text: You can specify a format style by providing an argument to the
method. The following example shows the decimal
represented in each of the available styles in the
locale:

Each style provides methods for updating its numeric configuration, including the number of significant digits, grouping length, and more. You can specify a numeric configuration by calling as many of these methods as you need in any order you choose. The following example shows the same number with default and custom configurations:

content.text: Creating a decimal format style instance

inlineContent.text: The previous examples use static instances like
to create format styles within the call to the
method. You can also create a
instance and use it to repeatedly format different values by using the
method, as shown here:
You can use
to parse strings into decimal values. You can define the format style within the type’s initializer or pass in a format style created outside the function. The following demonstrates both approaches:

Along with parsing numeric values in strings, you can use the Swift regular expression domain-specific language to match and capture numeric substrings. The following example defines a currency format style to match and capture a currency value using US dollars and
numeric conventions. The rest of the regular expression ignores any characters prior to a
sequence that precedes the currency substring.

abstract.text: Formats the decimal using a default localized format style.
Formats the decimal using the provided format style.
A structure that converts between decimal values and their textual representations.
Returns a Boolean value indicating whether two values are not equal.
Returns a Boolean value that indicates whether two values are equal.
An attributed format style based on the decimal format style.
Modifies the format style to use the specified decimal separator display strategy.
Encodes the value into the given encoder.
Formats a decimal value using this style.
Modifies the format style to use the specified grouping.
Hashes the essential components of the value by feeding them into the given hasher.
The hash value.
Creates a new instance by decoding from the given decoder.
Creates a decimal format style that uses the given locale.
Returns a format style to format a list of items.
Returns a format style to format a list of strings.
The locale of the format style.
Modifies the format style to use the specified locale.
Modifies the format style to use the specified notation.
A format style instance for use with decimal values.
The parse strategy that this format style uses.
Modifies the format style to use the specified precision.
Modifies the format style to use the specified rounding rule and increment.
Modifies the format style to use the specified scale.
Modifies the format style to use the specified sign display strategy for displaying or omitting sign symbols.
Returns a format style to use floating-point currency notation.
Returns a format style to use integer currency notation.
Returns a format style to format temperature units.
Returns a format style to format measurement units.
Process the input string within the specified bounds, beginning at the given index, and return the end position (upper bound) of the match and the produced output.
The regular expression represented by this component.
Creates a localized decimal format style that uses the given locale.
A format style that converts integers into attributed strings.
The type the format style uses for configuration settings.
A format style that converts between decimal currency values and their textual representations.
The type of data to format.
The type this format style produces as output from parsing.
A format style that converts between decimal percentage values and their textual representations.
The output type when you use this format style to match substrings.
The type this format style uses for its parse strategy.
A parse strategy for creating decimal values from formatted strings.
A type that provides localized representations of measurements.
Configuration settings for formatting numbers of different types.
